name: Sentiment Analysis Methods
description: Techniques for determining the emotional tone and intent behind communications.

cards.title: Emotion Detection in Text and Speech
cards.description: Using linguistic cues to infer emotions and psychological states.
bulletpoints: Identify affective markers such as tone, intensity, and sentiment shifts in written and spoken language
Distinguish between genuine, exaggerated, and suppressed emotional expressions through psycholinguistic analysis
Utilize Natural Language Processing (NLP) models to classify emotions into categories such as anger, joy, sadness, and fear
cards.summaryText: Blend psycholinguistic cues with NLP models to pinpoint the emotions driving a message.

cards.title: Social Media Sentiment Analysis
cards.description: Tracking public opinion and political movements through sentiment trends.
bulletpoints: Use artificial intelligence (AI) tools to detect sentiment trends in real-time across multiple social media platforms
Monitor mass communication channels for coordinated disinformation campaigns and narrative shifts
Correlate sentiment fluctuations with geopolitical, economic, and social events to predict potential unrest
cards.summaryText: Track social sentiment waves to spot coordinated narratives and forecast flashpoints.

cards.title: Sentiment Polarity and Opinion Mining
cards.description: Determining whether text conveys positive, negative, or neutral sentiment.
bulletpoints: Classify sentiment polarity using lexicon-based, machine learning, and hybrid approaches
Detect linguistic cues that indicate sarcasm, irony, or hidden sentiment
Evaluate opinion strength by analyzing intensifiers, negations, and rhetorical structures
cards.summaryText: Mine polarity signals, sarcasm cues, and intensity markers to read opinion direction accurately.

cards.title: Psycholinguistic Profiling for Threat Assessment
cards.description: Using language-based analysis to assess psychological intent and radicalization.
bulletpoints: Analyze language patterns to identify signs of stress, deception, or extremist ideology
Use linguistic markers to assess cognitive distortions in speech and writing
Employ stylometry to detect authorship similarities in online radicalization networks
cards.summaryText: Profile lexical patterns for stress, deception, or radical signals to prioritize threat reviews.

cards.title: Context-Aware Sentiment Analysis
cards.description: Evaluating sentiment with respect to contextual and cultural factors.
bulletpoints: Use semantic analysis to differentiate literal from figurative language
Account for cultural and demographic variations in emotional expression
Identify shifts in sentiment based on historical and regional linguistic norms
cards.summaryText: Layer cultural and semantic context onto sentiment scores to avoid misreads.

cards.title: Multimodal Sentiment Analysis
cards.description: Combining text, voice, and facial expressions for enhanced sentiment detection.
bulletpoints: Integrate text-based sentiment analysis with speech and visual emotion recognition
Analyze tonal shifts, voice modulation, and nonverbal cues to improve accuracy
Use deep learning techniques to fuse multimodal data for real-time emotion detection
cards.summaryText: Fuse text, audio, and visual signals with deep models for high-fidelity emotion reads.
